modules.serial_labware.Huber_Petite_Fleur package¶

Submodules¶

modules.serial_labware.Huber_Petite_Fleur.Huber_Petite_Fleur module¶

:mod:”Huber_Petite_Fleur” – API for Huber Petite Fleur remote controllable recirculation chiller¶

  1. 2018 The Cronin Group, University of Glasgow

This provides a python class for the Huber Petite Fleur recirculation chiller. Command implementation is based on the Data Communication Manual version 1.8.0 downloaded from the Huber homepage. The commands are supposed to work with any remote controllable Huber temperature controller, but was only tested with our Petite Fleur.

For style guide used see http://xkcd.com/1513/

class modules.serial_labware.Huber_Petite_Fleur.Huber_Petite_Fleur.Huber(port=None, device_name=None, connect_on_instantiation=False, soft_fail_for_testing=False)[source]¶

Bases: SerialDevice.serial_labware.SerialDevice

This provides a python class for the Huber chiller

get_setpoint()[source]¶

Reads the current temperature setpoint

get_temperature()[source]¶

Reads the current temperature of the bath

set_ramp_duration(ramp_duration)[source]¶

Sets the duration for a temperature ramp in seconds. Range is -32767…32767s where negative values cancel the ramp. Maximum ramp is a tad over 9 hours.

Parameters

ramp_duration (int) – duration of the ramp in seconds

set_temperature(temp)[source]¶

Sets the target temperature of the chiller

Parameters

temp (float) – Temperature setpoint

start()[source]¶

Starts the chiller

start_ramp(temp)[source]¶

Sets the target temperature of the chiller and starts a ramp towards that temperature.

Parameters

temp (float) – Temperature setpoint

stop()[source]¶

Stops the chiller
